chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Z: Type
Y: Type
X: Type
I: Type
R': relation2 X Y
R: relation2 X Y
S: relation2 Y Z
T: relation X
F: I -> relation2 X Y

Goal:
eeq (trans (union F)) (union (fun i : I => trans (F i)))

Premises:
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
union : forall X Y I : Type, (I -> X -> Y -> Prop) -> relation2 X Y
trans : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y X
eeq : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
union_eeq : forall (I X Y : Type) (F' F : I -> relation2 X Y), (forall i : I, eeq (F i) (F' i)) -> eeq (union F) (union F')
union_incl : forall (I X Y : Type) (F' F : I -> relation2 X Y), (forall i : I, incl (F i) (F' i)) -> incl (union F) (union F')
ssrfun.tagged : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x}, ?T_ (ssrfun.tag w) where ?I : [I : Type X : Type Y : Type Z : Type R : relation2 X Y R' : relation2 X Y S : relation2 Y Z T : relation X F : I -> relation2 X Y |- Type] ?T_ : [I : Type X : Type Y : Type Z : Type R : relation2 X Y R' : relation2 X Y S : relation2 Y Z T : relation X F : I -> relation2 X Y |- ?I -> Type]
comp_eeq : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), eeq R R' -> eeq S S' -> eeq (comp R S) (comp R' S')
union2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
trans_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq (trans R) (trans R')
comp : forall X Y Z : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Z -> relation2 X Z
eta2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
comp_incl : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), incl R R' -> incl S S' -> incl (comp R S) (comp R' S')
trans_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl (trans R) (trans R')
eeq_sym : forall (X Y : Type) (S R : relation2 X Y), eeq R S -> eeq S R
eeq_trans : forall (X Y : Type) (S R T : relation2 X Y), eeq R S -> eeq S T -> eeq R T
eeq_refl : forall (X Y : Type) (R : relation2 X Y), eeq R R
union2_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq R1 R1' -> eeq (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
incl_refl : forall (X Y : Type) (R : relation2 X Y), incl R R
incl_trans : forall (X Y : Type) (S R T : relation2 X Y), incl R S -> incl S T -> incl R T
union2_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl R1 R1' -> incl (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
inv_comp = conj (fun (x : Z) (y : X) (H : exists2 y0 : Y, R y y0 & S y0 x) => match H with | ex_intro2 _ _ t H0 H1 => ex_intro2 (fun y0 : Y => S y0 x) (fun y0 : Y => R y y0) t H1 H0 end) (fun (x : Z) (y : X) (H : exists2 y0 : Y, S y0 x & R y y0) => match H with | ex_intro2 _ _ t H0 H1 => ex_intro2 (fun y0 : Y => R y y0) (fun y0 : Y => S y0 x) t H1 H0 end) : eeq (trans (comp R S)) (comp (trans S) (trans R))
union_st : forall X Y : Type, set (relation2 X Y) -> X -> Y -> Prop
incl : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
inv_inv = conj (fun (x y : X) (H : T x y) => H) (fun (x y : X) (H : T x y) => H) : eeq (trans (trans T)) T
plus : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X
transitive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
reflexive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
antisymmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
symmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
set = fun X : Type => X -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments set _%type_scope
plus_wf : forall (X : Set) (R : relation X), well_founded (trans R) -> well_founded (trans (plus R))
Acc_clos_trans : forall (X : Set) (R : relation X) (x : X), Acc (trans R) x -> Acc (trans (plus R)) x
BinInt.Z.testbit_ones_nonneg : forall n i : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 i -> BinInt.Z.testbit (BinInt.Z.ones n) i = BinInt.Z.ltb i n
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
star_sind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> SProp), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
plus_eeq : forall (X : Type) (T' T : relation X), eeq T T' -> eeq (plus T) (plus T')
star_eeq : forall (X : Type) (T' T : relation X), eeq T T' -> eeq (star T) (star T')
BinInt.Z.testbit_ones : forall n i : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.testbit (BinInt.Z.ones n) i = (BinInt.Z.leb BinNums.Z0 i && BinInt.Z.ltb i n)%bool
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
ssrbool.ManifestMemPred : forall (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred T) (mem_pred_value : ssrbool.mem_pred T), mem_pred_value = ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => p x) -> ssrbool.manifest_mem_pred (T:=T) p
Qreduction.Qred_comp_Proper = fun (x y : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) => (fun (x0 y0 : QArith_base.Q) (H0 : QArith_base.Qeq x0 y0) => (fun lemma : QArith_base.Qeq (Qreduction.Qred x0) x0 => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive (Qreduction.Qred x0) x0 lemma (Qreduction.Qred y0) (Qreduction.Qred y0) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (Qreduction.Qred y0))) (Qreduction.Qred_correct x0) ((fun lemma : QArith_base.Qeq (Qreduction.Qred y0) y0 => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER QArith_base.Q_Setoid) (Qreduction.Qred y0) y0 lemma) (Qreduction.Qred_correct y0) H0)) x y H : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.res...
ssrbool.mem = fun (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T) => let '{| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} as pT0 := pT return (ssrbool.pred_sort pT0 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T) in fun A : ssrbool.pred_sort {| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} => ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => toP A x) : forall (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T), ssrbool.pred_sort pT -> ssrbool.mem_pred T Arguments ssrbool.mem {T}%type_scope {pT} A : rename, simpl never
Record manifest_mem_pred (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred T) : Type := ManifestMemPred { mem_pred_value : ssrbool.mem_pred T; _ : mem_pred_value = ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => p x) } Arguments ssrbool.manifest_mem_pred [T]%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.ManifestMemPred [T]%type_scope [p mem_pred_value]
